title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.16-17 | 06-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: O Brahmanas, do not think this to be especially wonderful in the activities of the mysterious and infallible personality of the Goddess.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 16th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on the qualities of the Supreme Lord, specifically Ashtariya, Maya, and Achyuta.

segments.key_quote: Nothing is impossible for the Supreme Lord, but all his actions are wonderful for us and thus he is always beyond the range of our conceivable limits.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the unlimited power of the Supreme Lord and how His actions are beyond human comprehension, foreshadowing the prayers of Queen Kunti.
The speaker introduces Queen Kunti's prayers as the main subject and discusses the unique perfection of Krishna compared to other expansions and living beings.

segments.key_quote: Kunti approached Krishna and addressed him.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the translation of the 17th verse, describing Kunti, her sons, and Draupadi addressing Krishna as he was about to depart for Dwaraka.

segments.key_quote: Pure devotion is completely independent of everything else.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's description of Kunti as a chaste devotee due to her unalloyed devotion, emphasizing the independence of pure bhakti from karma and jnana.
The speaker emphasizes that a pure devotee depends exclusively on Krishna for protection, not on other living beings or demigods, highlighting the importance of complete surrender.

segments.key_quote: One should look for all help from Krishna alone, who is competent always to save his devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the Pandava family as an example of complete dependence on Krishna, explaining the reciprocal relationship and warning against seeking imperfect help from other sources.
